metadata.Title: CVE-2021-43540 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WebExtensions with the correct permissions were able to create and install ServiceWorkers for third-party websites that would not have been uninstalled with the extension. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 95.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43540` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
